properties.name: Amici's
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 401 West Main Street, Avon, CTvia about.com (860) 677-7089. Amici is a very intimate setting for a date with a bowl of Fettuccini Genovese and a side salad—oh, and someone who\'s caught your eye, too. This Italian grill serves many other international foods including Greek Salad and Mediterranean Salad. The menu is reasonably priced with entrees such as Penne a la Vodka at only 1.99. This is the place to take your date out in style without making a huge investment.

properties.name: Andrew Molera State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Andrew Molera State Beach is very popular with nature-lovers. Cautions: Andrew Molera State Beach is a popular stop for nature-loving nudists. Clothing-optional has been discouraged by rangers to the point that few nudists still use it. If you want to go there, stick to the southernmost coves. Clothing-optional has been discouraged by rangers to the point that few nudists still use it. If you want to go there, stick to the southernmost coves. Off CA 1, between Bixby Creek Bridge and the Big Sur campground Well-marked entrance at milepost 51.20 parking on the side of the road The nude area is south of the Big Sur River Wait until low tide and wade south to the nude coves

properties.name: Arugula
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 953 Farmington Ave, West Hartford, CTvia about.com (860) 561-4888. This Mediterranean bistro is small, so make reservations. The seating is cozy enough for two, but with a décor that features many different shapes and angles, the ambiance is relaxed enough for a casual dinner. The Mediterranean dishes at Arugula are very good and perfect to share.

properties.name: Aspen (Ajax)
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname Weather Forecasts | Weather Maps | Weather Radar Aspen Mountain, a vertical smorgasbord of double-black and tree runs for skier and snowboarders, rises 3,267 feet from the heart of downtown Aspen. Opened in 1947, Aspen Mountain\'s steeps, bumps and incredible views have been famous for decades. If you\'re determined to see celebrities here, check out the tree runs on Aspen Mountain. Look for mystic "shrines" made by locals in homage of Jimi Hendrix, Elvis Presley, John Denver, Marilyn Monroe, Jerry Garcia and others. Be sure to read the Local\'s Lowdown on the Aspen Snowmass site. Click for a trail map in a new window.

properties.name: Aspen Highlands
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname Weather Forecasts | Weather Maps | Weather Radar Trails: easiest: 18%, more difficult: 30%, most difficult: 16%, expert: 36% Locals call Aspen Highlands their favorite, whether for its extreme terrain, groomed cruisers or breathtaking perspectives of the Maroon Bells. So, how does a 12,500-foot mountain top itself? If it\'s Aspen Highlands, it unveils Deep Temerity - acres of new advanced and expert terrain that opened for the 2005-2006 season along with the Deep Temerity triple chair, which rises 1,700 vertical feet in 7.3 minutes. New terrain will be added for the 2006-2007 season with a total buildout of 270 acres of new terrain in years to come! Be sure to have a look at the Local\'s Lowdown on the Snowmass website. Click for a trail map in a new window.

properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 228 Pearl St, Hartford, CTvia about.com (860) 244-WINE. Bin 228 is a cozy and perfect place for a first date without the pressure. Bruschetta, olives and smoked meats are a few of the Italian choices offered at this wine bar. A glass of wine and bruschetta make a quick, light meal if you\'re meeting someone for the first time. Surrounded by intriguing bottles perched on every wall, however, you may be tempted to order a bottle of wine, which will give you plenty of time to get to know your new flame.

properties.name: Black's Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Black\'s Beach, America\'s most popular, is still an active nudist site in the state-owned portion. If visit, do your part to keep it that way by respecting the boundary signs and covering up if you\'re going beyond them. Cautions: Nudity bans are enforced on the south end in the city-owned portion of Black\'s Beach (35 fine) Shuffle your feet in the water to avoid stingray injury

This bloodcurdling labyrinth includes 11 themed rooms of horror and NYC\'s only haunted 3-D maze, where guests receive 3-D glasses to view ghastly images as demons, monsters and ghouls stalk them. Blood Manor is meant to be intense and scary and is not recommended for those under 14 years of age.

properties.name: CMJ Music Marathon 10/31/06-11/04/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 70 Lincoln Center Plaza, NY, NYStarts at 9am. the 2006 CMJ Music Marathon, which will take place Oct 31-Nov 4 at Lincoln Center as well as at venues across New York City. While new music rules the nighttime, daytime events include panel discussions, mentoring sessions, interviews, exhibits, exclusive film screenings, and even more live performances. As in previous years, 12,000 music professionals and 100,000 fans are expected to be a part of CMJ Music Marathon. More than 1,000 artists spanning all genres will perform throughout the five-day festival. Attendees can also check out CMJ FilmFest, which last year hosted award-winning films such as Walk The Line, A History Of Violence, Thumbsucker, Martin Scorcese\'s No Direction Home and Elizabethtown. Previous CMJ FilmFests have featured appearances by Quentin Tarantino, Michael Moore, Harmony Korine, Trey Parker and Matt Stone, and Mike Mills among other visionary directors. get tickets

properties.name: Ghostly Tales and Tours 10/20-21 & 27-28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 29 East 4th Street, new York, NY2006, Friday & Saturday, October 20 & 21 and October 27 & 28. 7:00 pm-10:00 pm Merchant\'s House Museum, 29 East 4th Street between Lafayette and the Bowery. Take the N,R to 8th St.f, the 6 to Astor Place, or the F,B to Broadway/Lafayette 0, 3 members. Reservations and prepayment are required. Contact 212-777-1089 or YC1832@merchantshouse.com for more information. The old Merchant\'s House in the Village was built in 1832 and has been the site of nine deaths and eight family funerals. Take a spooky candlelit tour of the old mansion and explore tableaus depicting the death rituals of the 19th century. Hear spine-tingling tales of the spirits rumored to walk the halls of the old house.

properties.name: Ghouls and Gourds 10/29/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname1000 Washington Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11225Ghouls & Gourds Sunday, October 29, Noon–4:30 p.m. Let the "wild rumpus" start! Bring your costumes, instruments, and silly attitudes and prepare to be charmed by one of New York City\'s wackiest Halloween extravaganzas. Hot Peas \'N Butter—who stunned audiences from Symphony Space to the Tribeca Film Festival with their upbeat blend of Puerto Rican bomba plena, American folk, and groovy R&B—will have audiences of all ages dancing in the grass. The group will be joined by nine-year-old Puerto Rican dance prodigy Alize Roid. Rebecca Frezza and her Big Truck Band became an instant smash hit on Nickelodeon cable television with her song about gardening entitled H²O + O² + Sun. She promises to bring that song and more of her award-winning high octane rock \'n\' roll sounds to BBG audiences on the Cherry Esplanade. Parent\'s Choice Gold Award–winner Billy Jonas returns from Asheville, North Carolina, to sing about recycling, watermelon seeds, and Mount St. Helen with his one-man "industrial re-percussion" band. Plus use Sassafras-leaf rubbings to make a "ghost portrait," check out displays of "shrunken apple heads" and Thai pumpkin carving, or make your own recycled instrument to take home. The afternoon culminates with a Halloween costume parade led by drummers from the Brazilian percussion corps, Maracatu NY. Visiting ghouls and goblins can march to the beat of hundreds of zany percussion instruments, carry an assortment of larger-than-life puppets, or just show off their own costumes for all to see! via about.com

properties.name: Haleakala Crater Live Camera
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameHaleakala National ParkOne of the world\'s most spectacular views is from the Haleakala summit. All of Maui is at your feet. Pu\'u o Maui, the tallest cinder cone in the crater, is 500 feet tall from the crater\'s floor. You won\'t be able to see anything unless it\'s daylight in Hawaii. The image refreshes every five minutes and the tilt and zoom are controlled by scientists at the Institute for Astronomy.

properties.name: Halloween Dog Parade 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Saturday, October 28th, 2006 from Noon to 3:00 pm (time approximate, rain date is on Sunday) Where: First Run is located inside NYC\'s Tompkins Square Park near the entrance at 9th St. and Ave. A. Take the L to 1st Ave. Admission: Price of admission is a raffle ticket sold at the door. For more information, please visit www.FirstRunFriends.org Your dog can win you an iPod Nano. On October 28th, hundreds of costumed canines and thousand of spectators will march on Tompkins Square Park to participate in the country_s largest Halloween parade for dogs. This year, the pooches will be competing for over ,000 in prizes (categories include Best in Show, Best Owner & Dog Costume, and Best Trick). Prizes will include two Apple iPod Nano MP3 Players and a weekend getaway for pooch and owner. All proceeds go to the N. Y. Parks department for the renovation of First Run -- the city\'s oldest dog run.

properties.name: Halloween Spooktacular 10/27-28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  347 West 36th, new York, NYFriday, October 27th and Saturday, October 28th, 2006. Shows at 7:30 pm and 10 pm.National Comedy Theatre 347 West 36th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues.5 for adults and 2 for students, seniors and kids. For reservations, call 212-629-5202 or visit the National Comedy Theatre\'s web site. The National Comedy Theatre\'s Halloween Spooktacular is a Halloween improv comedy show described by producers as " sort of a combination Friday the 13th meets whose line is it." Every show features spooky games and an ending promised to be so bizarre that it will be discussed until Thanksgiving. The show is appropriate for all ages.

properties.name: Halloween parade and Pumpkin Sail 10/29/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Halloween Parade and Pumpkin Sail Where: The Charles A. Dana Discovery Center, inside the Park at 110th Street between Fifth and Lenox Avenues When: Saturday, October 29, 2PM-5PM Admission: FREE Bring a carved jack-o-latern (10 pounds or less) and dress in your Halloween finery to join this parade around the Harlem Meer. Judges will award prizes for the best costumes. The event will conclude with a flotilla of candle-lit pumpkins sailing across the Harlem Meer. It\'s free for all ages. For more information, call 212-860-1370.

properties.name: Haunted Prospect Park 10/29/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Haunted Walk and Carnival, 12 - 3 p.m. Take a scary walk through Prospect Park\'s woods, haunted by friendly gouls and goblins. Explore Lookout Hill and emerge in the Nethermead for a carnival full of fun, games, and surprises. Free. Begin at Prospect Park Southwest and 16th Street. October 28 only! Haunted Carousel, 12 - 5 p.m. Chilling music, ravens, bats, and spiders make spin on the Carousel a spooky treat. .50. Also October 29. Scary Stories from the Past, 2 & 3 p.m. Meet the old ghosts of Flatbush in haunting tales passed down from Lefferts ancestors. Free. Lefferts Historic House. Also October 29. Skeleton Scharen-Knippen Cut-Outs, 1 - 4 p.m. Make your own Halloween headbands using a traditional paper-cutting artform. Free. Lefferts Historic House. Also October 29. Creepy Crawly Halloween, 12 - 5 p.m. Creepy crafts, live critters and hands-on experiments. For families with children ages 3 to 12. Free. Audubon Center. Also October 29. Boo at the Zoo, 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Face painting, craft making, encounters with "spooky" creatures and a trip throught the Zoo\'s legendary haunted barn. Free with Zoo admission. Also October 29. via about.com

See the website for directions. When: Grounds: Daily, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Visitor Center: 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. M – F, closes at 3 p.m. on Saturday.

Where: 400 SW Kingston Ave., (inside Washington Park) When: Daily from 7:30 a.m. - 9:00 p.m. The roses begin blooming in early May and peak around the first week of June.

properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 2126 SW Halsey Street, Portland, OregonCall ahead Local: (503) 669-8610 Elsewhere: (800) 669-8610 The largest of McMenamins\' breweries, the Edgefield Brewery opened in 1991 in the old cannery building of the former Multnomah County Poor Farm. Impressive artwork by Joe Cotter and Scott Young depicts the history of beer along the walls and two of McMenamins\' more popular brews originated here: Black Rabbit Porter and Transformer Ale.

properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  34.41639, -119.8075More Mesa Beach is a very friendly and popular beach. Who\'s at More Mesa Beach: Friendly crowd, very social. See the comments above from Brad and stay north of the trail to prevent future law enforcement hassles.

properties.name: Near the Statue of Duke Kahanamoku
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameWaikiki BeachIt takes several seconds for this live webcam video to load. Be patient! You\'re on vaction, remember! Scroll down to read about Duke Kahanamoku and to watch a some short videos about Waikiki. by kahaluu808 Waikiki Scenes on Vimeo by Hawaii Duke Kahanamoku is the most famous name in surfing -- an Olympic champion, Hollywood actor and Hawaiian folk hero. He\'s also remembered for his grace in the water, his good humor, and his sportsmanship. Throughout his youth, Duke strove to refine his water skills. Swimming, surfing and canoeing were his passion. When top Australian swimmers visited the islands in 1910, Duke inspected their every move. He would use what he had learned from them to perfect his swimming. Duke\'s aquatic skills improved to such an extent that those who saw him were astonished. Bill Rawlins, an island attorney from Yale tried to help Duke get the recognition he deserved. However, to obtain official sanction for any aquatic records, swimmers had to belong to a recognized club. So Duke and his friends organized their own club in 1911 and named it Hui Nalu (Club of the Waves). Duke\'s astonishing swim times were sent to the Mainland, but they were so startling that officials refused to believe them. His supporters decided that the only thing they could do was raise money for Duke and another Hawaiian swimmer, Vincent Genoves, to travel to the Mainland to compete. In March of 1912 Duke Kahanamoku and fellow Hawaiian Vincent Genoves were in Pittsburgh Pennsylvania to compete for places on the American Olympic team. The Olympic swim trials were being held at various athletic clubs throughout the United States. On March 13th Duke had been in Chicago where he had won the 100-yard race. Now, in Pittsburgh two days later, Kahanamoku would compete in the 220-yard indoor race and Genoves in the 500-yard indoor swimming event. Unfortunately, Duke\'s leg would cramp when he hit the water, and he lost the race. Neither Hawaiian would win in Pittsburgh and only Kahanamoku would make the Olympic team and travel to Stockholm. Duke, who almost slept through the 100-meter dash, and who had to convince officials to delay the race long enough for him to put on a swim suit, broke the Olympic record in July of 1912. He had been clocked at sixty-three and two-fifths seconds. Pandemonium reigned and the Hawaiian swimmer became a hero. He was now the most famous Hawaiian alive, and he had done much to publicize the islands. On January 22, 1968 the world would bid "Aloha" to Hawaii\'s most famous citizen. He would be remembered as a great swimmer, surfer and all-around good guy. More than 20-years after his death memories of his achievements and affecting personable style still linger.

properties.name: Panther Beach and Hole-in-the-Wall
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Just a little about 10 miles north of Santa Cruz, Panther Beach is a local secret and is a spectacular place to enjoy a picnic lunch, or the beauty of the pacific or climb a boulder or two. This beach area is gorgeous! There is a large boulderable arch, and many beachside climbing sections at this little oasis. In the middle of the Beachside Wall there is a cave extending 10 feet into the rock. At the left side of entrance, there are a few good hands within reach above the overhang of the cave. The landings are in the sand, so it makes it fairly safe for dropping. Without questions, Panther Beach is known for rock climbing and the difficulties in climb ranges from very easy to more advanced climbs, putting you over 25 feet in the air. Because a lot of the rock is sandstone, climbing should however be done with caution. The high tide also will affect some of the routes. DIRECTIONS: CA Hiway1 just south of Davenport between milepost 26.86 and 26.4. The entrance is very hard to see when coming from the north. Look for a dirt road between the west side of highway and the railroad track and be prepared to make a very sharp turn. Parking: Park on the dirt between the highway and the railroad tracks (west of the highway) Take special care with your belongings, as vandalism has been reported there. Walking: From the north end of the parking area, cross the tracks and follow the trail. It is steep and eroded, use with caution and watch for poison oak. The only way to get to Hole in the Wall is to walk through the hole in the rocks at the south end of the beach, but do not try it at high tide and be sure to get back before the tide comes in. NOTE: Directly next to Panther Beach is Hole in the Wall, which is considered a nude beach. ACTIVITIES: An incredible beach for nature sight seeing, bird watching, rock climbing, sun bathing, or just enjoying a picnic lunch.

properties.name: Park Slope Halloween Parade 10/31/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Tuesday, October 31st The Park Slope Civic Council hosts its annual kids\' Halloween parade and party for children of all ages. Parade will start at 7th Avenue and 12th Street and proceed to 7th Avenue and Union Street. Participants may join the parade at any point along this route. The Headless Horsewoman will join the parade, as well as parade bands -- Paprika and Eternal Buzz Brass Band. You can also join the party at 4:30 pm; Prospect Park YMCA. Parade at 6:30 pm.

For events, check the online calendar.

properties.name: Pirate's Cove
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname Description: * Quarter mile long cove * One of the most beautiful nude beach settings * No fishermen here, so it\'s easy to walk without fear of getting "caught." Who\'s at Pirate\'s Cove: * Up to 200 on weekends * Suited and not * Almost half are women * 10 percent families * Gawkers on the cliff and on the beach Pirate\'s Cove Facilities: None About 7 miles south of San Luis Obispo and 5 miles north of Pismo Beach off US 101. Take the Avila Beach exit Follow the signs toward Avila Beach for 2.0 miles As soon as the golf course is visible, look for a road to the left going uphill Turn left on Cave Landing Rd Follow the road to a dirt parking lot at the end Pirate\'s Cove in Avila Bay should not be confused with Pirate\'s Cove in Los Angeles. This beach is also called Cave Landing or Mallagh Landing. Take the trail at the south (left) end of the lot Stay to the left go down the long series of steps At the sand, walk east to the far end of the beach The nude area is near the volleyball net

properties.name: Procession of the Ghouls 10/27/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  1047 Amsterdam Ave, new York, NYFriday, October 27th, 2006 at 7PM and 9PM Visit the magnificent Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine for an evening of thrills and chills. Enjoy a screening of the classic 1922 creepfest Nosferatu, accompanied by the ominous sounds of the cathedral organ. The film is followed by the famous Grand Procession of the Ghouls, a dramatic parade of fabulous puppets, creatures and special effects.Where: Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, 112th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, one block east of Broadway. Getting There: 1 or 9 train to 110th Street/Cathedral Parkway. M4, M104 bus to Broadway and 112th Street or M11 to Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street. Tickets: 5, for students and seniors Seating: Space is limited due to restoration work so all seating is general admission, first come-first served. The line for admission for ticket-holders will start outside Cathedral doors 45 minutes to an hour before doors open (doors open one hour prior to performance time). For more information, call 212-316-7540.

Audience participation is encouraged as the little turtle outsmarts a fierce leopard. Adapted from an African folktale by Sandra Robbins and is performed by Leena Conquest and Ayanda Clarke. Costume parade of audience and performers directly follow the show. Goodie bags will be given out while supplies last. Costumes are encouraged. Doors open at 2:30pm for a 3pm performance. Admission is free and no reservations are required, however space is limited.

properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   108 W Burnside St, Portland, ORvia About.com What: Hundreds of vendors sell imports, handmade goods and foods from around the world. properties.name: Scott's Creek Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  37.0408, -122.2281Scott Creek Beach is an easily accessible nude beach near a busy family beach area. Description: One half mile long beach at the bottom of a small bluff. At the north end there is a a great surfing spot. Who\'s at Scott Creek Beach: Surfers (Oct - May), suited sunbathers, skinny-dippers. Lots of families (clothed) in the area near the road Driving: North of Davenport on CA 1between mileposts 31.8 and 31.29 This beach is very easy to find, it\'s one of the few places where the road is at ocean level and the beach comes right up to the road. Telephone call box SZ-001-318 is just north of the beach. Parking: Two turnouts for parking Be careful not to get stuck in the sand. Park with your drive wheels toward the pavement. Walking: Descend north or south of the bridge It\'s easy to get onto the beach from the road, but walking north across Scott Creek can be hazardous when the creek is flowing strongly The nude area is at the bottom of the cliff

properties.name: Some of the Best Windsurfing in the World
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameNear Kahana Beach and Camp OneKanaha is one of the most popular international windsurfing destinations. On the beach you will find sailors from Asia, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, Canada and the USA. While this makes rigging enriching it can be confusing on the water since it is clear some do not know the rules of the road. The long sandy beach is backed by shady lawns and thorn dropping Kiave trees so wear sandals. The wind in the summer is mostly side-onshore and strong and steady. There is little shore break because of the reef running parallel to the beach about 800 feet from shore. In the spring and fall the wind has more ENE in it. These ENE winds produce gusty side shore winds with blasts and lulls near the beach. Do not launch until 11AM at any of the sites in Maui. This rule was established because it is extremely difficult to see the local spear fishermen who can work the reef until 11am. by Aleka

properties.name: Trapped in Purgatory, every weekend in October 2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  5050 Haylen Blvd. Staten island, NYTrapped in Purgatory will take you through the world of the tortured lost souls and Lucifer\'s Rejects. In Purgatory you\'ll be bombarded by scare after scare and amazing special effects. For more information view our Frequently asked questions below: Are there any kids activities that aren\'t scary? Yes! We have a daytime Pumpkin Playland that is fun for all ages! The playland is open 7 days a week from 8AM until 7PM. For More information on the Greenside Up Pumpkin Playland click here! Are there any special pricing for kids? Yes during the day we have special pricing for our daytime family activities. How long does it take? It depends on how fast you can run! 10-15 minute walkthrough times but that can be cut in half if your running and screaming the whole time! Will there be special effects? Yes we have stobe effects, animated characters and fog machines are also in use. Get tickets

properties.name: Vaughn's Public House
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 59 Pratt Street, Hartford, CTvia about.com (860) 882-1560. If you think your date might enjoy a quaint public house that serves traditional Irish food with an American twist, head to Vaughn’s. Hearty meals such as Shepherd’s Pie and Guinness Lamb Stew are just a few of the items on the menu. Salads and soups are available if you prefer lighter fare. There is always something to talk about at Vaughn’s. Upstairs tables are great for a first date; they provide a look out over the restaurant and bar.

properties.name: Zmudowski State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  North of Moss Landing, CAA nice beach, but this is mostly a clothed family beach. Suit up if you see a ranger approaching. Zmudowski Beach is nice, but this is mostly a clothed family beach that only gets occasional nude use. The former nude beach here known as Hidden Beach is now a clothed beach. Description: Soft sand and warm Who\'s at Zmudowski Beach: A few hundred visitors on a hot day, but the beach is big and doesn\'t seem crowded Zmudowski Beach Facilities: Portable toilets in parking lot Driving: Just north of Moss Landing on CA 1, just south of mile 98.0 Follow the signs toward Zmudowski State Beach Turn onto Struve Road and go 0.2 miles to its intersection with Giberson Road (left) Follow Giberson as it zigzags 2.0 miles to its end, at the state beach parking lot Parking: Free parking lot Walking: Hike to the north end of the beach via the dirt access road that starts at the small lot Clothing-optional bathers usually gather behind the dunes

properties.name: garrapata beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Near Carmel, CAGarrapata Beach is a nice beach noted for its scenic beauty. Rangers have been given discretion to cite nudists if anyone complains, and with a lot of families here on weekends, the likelihood of complaints is increased. * A mile of clean sand, lagoon, coves, caves * Wildflowers in spring and early summer * The central part of the beach can be cooler than the ends because of the wind Who\'s at Garrapata Beach: Clothed and unclothed. Singles, families, locals, tourists, gays, and straights Garrapata Beach Facilities: None Garrapata Beach Activities: Swimming not recommended. Waves are very hazardous Driving: South of Carmel on CA 1 near milepost 63.1, shortly past the Garrapata State Beach sign, 9.6 miles south of the Rio Road traffic light in Carmel. The house below is just beyond the parking area Parking: Large parking area along the highway Walking: The obvious trail leads to the middle of the beach. Near the beach, it forks. The left trail goes down to the middle of the beach and the right one follows the edge of the cliffs, eventually descending to a creek and the beach. This path could be dangerous when the creek is flowing strongly. The nude area is on the far north end of the beach

properties.name: summerland Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Summerland beach is south of Santa Barbara, with sandy coves. Getting to Summerland Beach: 6 miles south of Santa Barbara on US 101. Exit at Evans and turn left under the freeway. Take the next left and drive 0.3 mile. At the recycling center sign, turn right just before the freeway into a long parking lot. Go down the ramp to the beach, then walk south to the nude area, which starts below the only house on the bluffs
